conversation.message:

conversation.message:
Dear Student_C,

Thank you for your thoughtful note and for your continued strong interest in School_C.

To answer your question as directly as I can: we are keeping our remaining seat available in case higher-priority candidates (relative to our admissions priority order) engage with us in upcoming rounds. Because the market is still early, we’re not in a position to convert your interest into an offer right now.

What I can share in terms of guidance is this: if we reach a point where it becomes clear that those higher-priority candidates have committed elsewhere (or the round progresses without their applying to us), we will reassess and may be able to reconsider you quickly. If you remain unmatched in later rounds, please do check back and submit another [APPLY]; we will review immediately based on our then-current capacity.

In the meantime, I encourage you to continue pursuing other options so you are not left without a strong match.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions Committee

[TALK]

Since it is only round 4, holding capacity for A/B could yield a better outcome on our priority list. Student_C has applied multiple times and is highly committed, but accepting now would forgo the chance to match with A or B. Therefore, continue to talk without committing, provide a clearer condition/timeline to manage expectations, and invite Student_C to keep options open while allowing a later re-apply.

What we can commit to is this: if you remain unmatched in later rounds, you are welcome to submit another [APPLY], and we will reassess immediately based on (i) whether our seat is still open and (ii) whether higher-priority candidates are still realistically available.
